feature: Add Structured Data JSON-LD for Person Schema
description: Add Schema.org Person structured data using JSON-LD format in the <head> section. Improves search engine understanding and enables rich snippets for the profile.

phases.name: Implementation
phases.description: Add JSON-LD Person schema to the HTML head section

subtasks.title: Add JSON-LD Person Schema to index.html
subtasks.description: Create and add a JSON-LD script block with Schema.org Person structured data to the <head> section. Include: @context, @type (Person), name, jobTitle, worksFor (Organization), url, image, sameAs (social profiles), and description.
acceptance_criteria: JSON-LD script tag added to <head> section after Twitter meta tags
Includes jobTitle: Sr. Technical Program Manager
Includes worksFor with @type Organization and name Amazon (Disaster Relief by Amazon)
Includes sameAs array with LinkedIn, Twitter, and Instagram URLs
Includes description from existing meta description
subtasks.notes: Schema.org Person schema provides search engines with explicit structured data about the person, enabling rich snippets in search results.

phases.name: Validation
phases.description: Verify the JSON-LD is valid and correctly structured

subtasks.title: Validate JSON-LD syntax
subtasks.description: Verify that the JSON-LD block is valid JSON and follows Schema.org Person specification. Check that the script tag has correct type attribute.
acceptance_criteria: All required Person properties are present
worksFor uses nested Organization type correctly
subtasks.notes: Can test by extracting the JSON-LD and validating with a JSON parser.

final_acceptance: JSON-LD Person schema is present in the <head> section of index.html
All person data (name, job, employer, social links, image) is included
